extendedInfo.description: The BoatCoach display shows rowers their stroke rate, stroke count, distance, speed, time, elapsed time, calories and heart rate.BoatCoach is perfect for competitive and casual rowing alike.You can graph your workout and plot speed, stroke rate, and heart rate vs. distance and time.  Pinch & zoom to highlight specific portions.All of your workout history is available online with interactive charts & graphs at www.boatcoachapp.com.BoatCoach also has a unique map page that not only shows you where you are on a Google map, but also shows you the location of all other rowers on the water who are using BoatCoach.  Click on a boat and find out what their stroke rate is or how fast theyâre going.  Great for meeting up for workouts or for tracking your favorite boats during races!You can easily Tweet or Facebook a summary of your workout with just a press of the button.  You can also email (or DropBox) all your workout details to yourself.BoatCoach not only saves you from spending hundreds of dollars on a dedicated stroke meter, but it also provides social features not possible using a dedicated device.To measure your heart rate youâll need to buy a heart rate monitor from Zephyr.  See below for further information.More details and photos available at... http://www.boatcoachapp.comQuestions, comments, suggestions, issues... please email boatcoachapp@gmail.comFEATURES INCLUDE...MEASUREMENTS  - Stroke rate  - Stroke count  - Distance  - Speed average  - Speed for the last 10 strokes  - Clock  - Elapsed time  - Calories  - Heart rateINDICATORS  - Stroke sensor  - GPS strength  - Heart rate monitor connectionWORKOUTS  - Manually start / stop / clear /pause / resume pieces  - Hands-free autostart pieces  - Save / delete / email workout or use DropBox (requires DropBox app to be installed)  - View workout history  - View individual workout detailsMAP  - See where you are on Google map  - View other rowers using BoatCoach and see their stroke rate, speed, etc  - Toggle between satellite and street view  - Great for races, meeting up for workouts, coachingGRAPH WORKOUT  - Plot speed, stroke rate, and heart rate vs. distance and time (do this *before* you exit BoatCoach)  - Adjust y-axis max/min to optimize display area  - Pinch & zoom to view in more detail  - Email yourself graphsSOCIAL  - Tweet todayâs workout  - Facebook todayâs workoutHEART RATE SENSOR  - Check and record your heart rate  - Requires Zephyr heart rate monitor  - Save $5 when you order your Zephyr HxM Android heart rate monitor at www.ZephyrAnywhereStore.com and use promotion code "BoatCoach1"SETTINGS  - View distance in meters, kilometers, feet, miles  - View speed in m/s, km/hr, ft/s, miles/hr, min/500m, min/1000m, min/mile  - View calories in calories burned, calories/hr, and donuts  - Turn on/off GPS and heart rate monitor  - Set clock to 12/24 hour format  - Enter your nickname, club, boat, weight  - Optimize stroke sensor sensitivity  - 3 different screen layouts (normal, race, stroke only) to optimize text size  - Several screen colorsSTROKE ANALYSIS  - View acceleration vs. time graph for your boat  - Email graphs to yourself  - Help optimize your strokeDATA CAPTURE  - Collect data about your rowing every 1 to 30 seconds.  Speed, distance, heart rate, stroke rate, GPS location, etc.  - OR, collect detailed boat acceleration data every 1/30 sec.  - Email yourself .CSV files for post-workout analysis in a spreadsheet like Excel  - Email yourself .GPX files for mapping your workout in Endomondo, Garmin Connect, and other applications.OTHER  - BoatCoach has been fully tested for rowing (sculls & sweeps) and dragon boats.  Less testing has been done on kayaks and canoes, but I'd be happy to work with you if you find problems.BoatCoach is Copyright (c) by Dan Eiref

reviews.title: Good but ...
reviews.comment: It used to work good on my old but still useful HTC Wildfire, albeit the bottom of the screen was not visible, but since I switched to a new phone (Huwei Y300) I found mediocre results. GPS and speed are working fine but the stroke rate is way off and annoying. Rowing at 28 spm it shows  stroke rates ranging from 14 till 42 I\'ve repositioned the phone, tried different. setting all to no avail I mailed the developer but haven\'t heared a possible fix.  If it is working on your phone then it is a marvellous app but be aware that it can be disfunctional on some phones without hte developer helping.
reviews.author: Michiel Oosterhagen

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: Does what you need in a reliable way every time.  Sets itself up.   Thanks
reviews.author: Dennis Fronheiser

reviews.title: Amazing works
reviews.comment: Works just like an nk stroke coach  Used it today with 6x3 minutes coxing a quad took the rates spot on just held the phone by the shell and it felt the rock and took perfect readings  Also even just great for a timer of pieces  Also took the speed well and took down the length we rowed  At the end seeing 1556 strokes was another great thing  To be honest I would use this over a stroke coach but probably unless you have a water proof case and a stand in your foot stops it would be best off with the cox.
reviews.author: Gavin Farrell

reviews.title: great stuff!
reviews.comment: I\'ve tried this app in a 20k outing and it worked brilliantly (I was stroking our club\'s 8-Yolle and it really helped me to have a feel of what the stroke rate should be!). Having the data exported to be later analysed is also a great thing.  Haven\'t tried the \"social\" feature because not many rowers know about this app (yet!).  Pity that the battery life on my phone is terrible, otherwise this could actually replace a more expensive NK stroke counter! :)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Best
reviews.comment: The best app, I row with this every day, it 100% accurate, thanks!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Neutral
reviews.comment: Couldn\'t install app. It wouldn\'t get past \"location\" settings. Maybe it was me and not the app.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Love the apps. I use it every time when I\'m OC\'s.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: Just tried it out once. Easy to use and works well for dragon boating.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: A very complete app.
reviews.comment: Fullfills the needs for the everyday rowing experience. Accurate in stroke rate and fast setup. A complex logfile with all data you need. Could be easier to use the file but a short look around the web and then it was without major trouble to import it to Google Earth.  Very nice app. Recommended.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: \"last 10 strokes\" feature
reviews.comment: The new \"last 10 strokes\" feature is really cool.  It shows my speed for the last 10 strokes, compared to my average, and I found out that when I take up the stroke rate the boat doesn\'t always go faster!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great app for rowing!!
reviews.comment: Worked perfectly out of the box with virtually no setup required.  Locks onto my stroke rate even in rough water.    The distance measurement seems almost 100% accurate (I measured against a buoyed 2000m course).    I\'ve also been using the speed measurement to help gauge my power application and the heart rate indicator to tell me when I\'m in my aerobic and anaerobic zones.  I haven\'t used the map function that much, but as more rowers start using BoatCoach I expect this will be really cool for races.  Overall, thanks, great app!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Best companion for rowing and paddling.
reviews.comment: The only App on the Android market that both displays and log critical stroke data for post analysis.   Being a rower himself, Dan the developer is the without a doubt the most responsive App developer I have ever contacted.
reviews.author: A Google User
